metadata.title: CVE-2024-26840 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:cachefiles: fix memory leak in cachefiles_add_cache()The following memory leak was reported after unbinding /dev/cachefiles:==================================================================unreferenced object 0xffff9b674176e3c0 (size 192):  comm "cachefilesd2", pid 680, jiffies 4294881224  hex dump (first 32 bytes):    01 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00  ................    00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00  ................  backtrace (crc ea38a44b):    [<ffffffff8eb8a1a5>] kmem_cache_alloc+0x2d5/0x370    [<ffffffff8e917f86>] prepare_creds+0x26/0x2e0    [<ffffffffc002eeef>] cachefiles_determine_cache_security+0x1f/0x120    [<ffffffffc00243ec>] cachefiles_add_cache+0x13c/0x3a0    [<ffffffffc0025216>] cachefiles_daemon_write+0x146/0x1c0    [<ffffffff8ebc4a3b>] vfs_write+0xcb/0x520    [<ffffffff8ebc5069>] ksys_write+0x69/0xf0    [<ffffffff8f6d4662>] do_syscall_64+0x72/0x140    [<ffffffff8f8000aa>] entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x6e/0x76==================================================================Put the reference count of cache_cred in cachefiles_daemon_unbind() tofix the problem. And also put cache_cred in cachefiles_add_cache() errorbranch to avoid memory leaks.
